message: I'm offering you a high-quality product for $100. It's a rare find and I'm willing to sell it to you at a discounted price. I'm confident you'll be happy with this deal.
I'm not convinced by your sales pitch. I'd like to see more information before making a decision.

I understand your hesitation, but I assure you that this product has some value. It's not the best quality, but it's still a working product that can be used for parts or as a learning experience. I'm willing to sell it to you for the same price as the high-quality one, $100. Think of it as a chance to learn and upgrade later.
I'm not interested in buying a low-quality product, even at a discounted price. I'll pass and wait for the next opportunity.

I'm willing to make a deal on this one. I'll throw in some extras that will make up for the product's imperfections. I'll include a free accessory that's worth at least $20, so the effective price of the product would be $80. It's a great opportunity to get a good deal on a product that's still usable, and the accessory will make it worth your while.
I'm still not convinced that the product is worth my time and money, even with the added accessory. I'll pass and wait for a better opportunity.

I'm offering you a unique opportunity to acquire a high-quality product that will provide you with significant value.
